00034   AudioResampler :: AudioResampler()
00035   {
00036     mContext = 0;
00037     mOChannels=0;
00038     mOSampleRate=0;
00039     mIChannels=0;
00040     mISampleRate=0;
00041     mPtsOffset=0;
00042     mOFmt = IAudioSamples::FMT_S16;
00043     mIFmt = IAudioSamples::FMT_S16;
00044     mFilterLen = 0;
00045     mLog2PhaseCount = 0;
00046     mIsLinear = false;
00047     mCutoff = 1.0;
00048     mNextPts = Global::NO_PTS;
00049   }
00050 
00051   AudioResampler :: ~AudioResampler()
00052   {
00053     if (mContext)
00054       audio_resample_close(mContext);
00055   }

00061       )
00062   {
00063     return make(outputChannels, inputChannels, outputRate, inputRate,

00067   AudioResampler*
00068   AudioResampler :: make(
00069       int32_t outputChannels, int32_t inputChannels,
00070       int32_t outputRate, int32_t inputRate,
00071       IAudioSamples::Format outputFmt, IAudioSamples::Format inputFmt
00072       )
00073   {
00074     return make(outputChannels, inputChannels, outputRate, inputRate,
00075         outputFmt, inputFmt,
00076         16, 10, 0, 0.8);

00079   AudioResampler*
00080   AudioResampler :: make(
00081       int32_t outputChannels, int32_t inputChannels,
00082       int32_t outputRate, int32_t inputRate,
00083       IAudioSamples::Format outputFmt, IAudioSamples::Format inputFmt,
00084       int32_t filterLen, int32_t log2PhaseCount,
00085       bool linear, double cutoff
00086       )
00087   {
00088     AudioResampler* retval = 0;
00089     try {
00090       if (outputChannels <= 0)
00091         throw std::invalid_argument("outputChannels <= 0");
00092 
00093       if (inputChannels <= 0)
00094         throw std::invalid_argument("inputChannels <= 0");
00095 
00096       if (outputChannels > 2)
00097         throw std::invalid_argument("outputChannels > 2; unsupported");
00098 
00099       if (inputChannels > 2)
00100         throw std::invalid_argument("inputChannels > 2; unsupported");
00101 
00102       if (outputRate <= 0)
00103         throw std::invalid_argument("outputRate <= 0");
00104 
00105       if (inputRate <= 0)
00106         throw std::invalid_argument("inputRate <= 0");
00107 
00108       if (filterLen <= 0)
00109         throw std::invalid_argument("filterLen <= 0");
00110 
00111       if (log2PhaseCount < 0)
00112         throw std::invalid_argument("log2PhaseCount < 0");
00113 
00114       if (cutoff < 0)
00115         throw std::invalid_argument("cutoffFrequency < 0");
00116 
00117       retval = AudioResampler::make();
00118       if (retval)
00119       {
00120         retval->mContext = av_audio_resample_init(outputChannels, inputChannels,
00121             outputRate, inputRate,
00122             (enum SampleFormat) outputFmt, (enum SampleFormat) inputFmt,
00123             filterLen, log2PhaseCount, (int)linear, cutoff);
00124         if (retval->mContext)
00125         {
00126           retval->mOChannels = outputChannels;
00127           retval->mOSampleRate = outputRate;
00128           retval->mIChannels = inputChannels;
00129           retval->mISampleRate = inputRate;
00130           retval->mOFmt = outputFmt;
00131           retval->mIFmt = inputFmt;
00132           retval->mFilterLen = filterLen;
00133           retval->mLog2PhaseCount = log2PhaseCount;
00134           retval->mIsLinear = linear;
00135           retval->mCutoff = cutoff;
00136         }
00137         else
00138         {
00139           VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00140         }
00141       }
00142     }
00143     catch (std::bad_alloc & e)
00144     {
00145       VS_LOG_ERROR("Error: %s", e.what());
00146       VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00147       throw e;
00148     }
00149     catch (std::exception & e)
00150     {
00151       VS_LOG_ERROR("Error: %s", e.what());
00152       VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00153     }
00154     return retval;
00155   }

00185   int32_t
00186   AudioResampler :: getMinimumNumSamplesRequiredInOutputSamples(
00187       IAudioSamples *inSamples)
00188   {
00189     int32_t retval = -1;
00190     try {
00191       int32_t numSamples = 0;
00192       if (inSamples)
00193       {
00194         if (!inSamples->isComplete())
00195           throw std::invalid_argument("input samples are not complete");
00196         
00197         if (inSamples->getSampleRate() != mISampleRate)
00198           throw std::invalid_argument("unexpected input sample rate");
00199 
00200         if (inSamples->getChannels() != mIChannels)
00201           throw std::invalid_argument("unexpected # of input channels");
00202         
00203         if (inSamples->getFormat() != mIFmt)
00204           throw std::invalid_argument("unexpected sample format");
00205 
00206         numSamples = inSamples->getNumSamples();
00207       } else {
00208         numSamples = 0;
00209       }
00210       retval = getMinimumNumSamplesRequiredInOutputSamples(numSamples);
00211     }
00212     catch (std::invalid_argument & e)
00213     {
00214       VS_LOG_DEBUG("invalid argument: %s", e.what());
00215       retval = -1;
00216     }
00217     catch (std::exception & e)
00218     {
00219       VS_LOG_DEBUG("Unknown exception: %s", e.what());
00220     }
00221     return retval;
00222   }
00223   
00224   int32_t
00225   AudioResampler :: getMinimumNumSamplesRequiredInOutputSamples(
00226       int32_t numSamples)
00227   {
00228     int32_t retval = -1;
00229 
00230     try
00231     {
00232       if (numSamples < 0)
00233         throw std::invalid_argument("numSamples < 0 not allowed");
00234       
00235       double conversionRatio = 1;
00236       {
00237         double top = mOSampleRate;
00238         VS_ASSERT(top, "should never be zero");
00239         double bot = mISampleRate;
00240         VS_ASSERT(bot, "should never be zero");
00241         conversionRatio = top/bot;
00242         VS_ASSERT(conversionRatio > 0, "the variables used should have been checked on construction");
00243       }
00244       if (conversionRatio <= 0)
00245         throw std::invalid_argument("programmer error");
00246 
00247       // FFMPEG's re-sample function doesn't let you specify the size of your
00248       // output buffer, but does use up all the space you might expect
00249       // plus 16-bytes as a lead-in/lead-out for it to seed the resampler.
00250       // Hence, the hard-coded 16 here.
00251       // NOTE: 16 might change IF the value of filters in the audio_resample
00252       // method in libavcodec/resample.c changes.
00253 #define VS_FFMPEG_AUDIO_RESAMPLER_LEADIN 16
00254       retval = 
00255           (int32_t)((numSamples * conversionRatio)+VS_FFMPEG_AUDIO_RESAMPLER_LEADIN+0.5);
00256     }
00257     catch (std::invalid_argument & e)
00258     {
00259       VS_LOG_DEBUG("invalid argument: %s", e.what());
00260       retval = -1;
00261     }
00262     catch (std::exception & e)
00263     {
00264       VS_LOG_DEBUG("Unknown exception: %s", e.what());
00265     }
00266 
00267     return retval;
00268   }
00269   
00270   int
00271   AudioResampler :: resample(IAudioSamples * pOutSamples,
00272       IAudioSamples* pInSamples,
00273       unsigned int numSamples)
00274   {
00275     int retval = -1;
00276     AudioSamples* outSamples = dynamic_cast<AudioSamples*>(pOutSamples);
00277     AudioSamples* inSamples = dynamic_cast<AudioSamples*>(pInSamples);
00278     unsigned int sampleSize=0;
00279 
00280     try {
00281       if (!outSamples)
00282         throw std::invalid_argument("no output samples");
00283       
00284       if (outSamples == inSamples)
00285         throw std::invalid_argument("resampling into the same IAudioSamples is not allowed");
00286 
00287       // null out the output samples.
00288       outSamples->setComplete(false, 0, mOSampleRate, mOChannels,
00289           mOFmt, Global::NO_PTS);
00290 
00291       if (inSamples)
00292       {
00293         if (!inSamples->isComplete())
00294           throw std::invalid_argument("input samples are not complete");
00295         
00296         if (inSamples->getSampleRate() != mISampleRate)
00297           throw std::invalid_argument("unexpected input sample rate");
00298 
00299         if (inSamples->getChannels() != mIChannels)
00300           throw std::invalid_argument("unexpected # of input channels");
00301         
00302         if (inSamples->getFormat() != mIFmt)
00303           throw std::invalid_argument("unexpected sample format");
00304 
00305         if (numSamples == 0)
00306           numSamples = inSamples->getNumSamples();
00307         else
00308           numSamples = FFMIN(numSamples, inSamples->getNumSamples());
00309         sampleSize = inSamples->getSampleBitDepth()/8;
00310       } else {
00311         numSamples = 0;
00312         sampleSize = IAudioSamples::findSampleBitDepth(mIFmt)/8;
00313       }
00314 
00315       int32_t neededSamples = getMinimumNumSamplesRequiredInOutputSamples(numSamples);
00316       int32_t bytesPerOutputSample = mOChannels*IAudioSamples::findSampleBitDepth(mOFmt)/8;
00317       int32_t neededBytes = neededSamples * bytesPerOutputSample;
00318       // This causes a buffer resize to occur if needed
00319       if (outSamples->ensureCapacity(neededBytes) < 0)
00320         throw std::runtime_error("attempted to resize output buffer but failed");
00321       
00322       uint32_t outBufSize = outSamples->getMaxBufferSize();
00323       int32_t gap = (neededSamples*bytesPerOutputSample)-outBufSize;
00324       
00325       if (gap > 0) {
00326 //        VS_LOG_ERROR("maxBufferSize: %d; neededSampleRoom: %d; sampleSize: %d; numSamples: %d; conversionRatio: %f;",
00327 //            (int32_t)outSamples->getMaxBufferSize(),
00328 //            neededSampleRoom,
00329 //            sampleSize,
00330 //            numSamples,
00331 //            conversionRatio);
00332         throw std::invalid_argument("not enough room in output buffer");
00333       }
00334       short * inBuf = inSamples ? inSamples->getRawSamples(0) : 0;
00335 
00336       short *outBuf = outSamples->getRawSamples(0);
00337       if (!outBuf)
00338         throw std::invalid_argument("could not get output bytes");
00339 
00340       VS_ASSERT(mContext, "Should have been set at initialization");
00341       if (!mContext)
00342         throw std::invalid_argument("programmer error");
00343 
00344       // Now we should be far enough along that we can safely try a resample.
00345       retval = audio_resample(mContext, outBuf, inBuf, numSamples);
00346 
00347 #if 0
00348       if (retval >0){
00349         char string[2048*16+1];
00350         unsigned int i=0;
00351         for (i = 0; i < sizeof(string)-1; i++)
00352           string[i] = 'X';
00353 
00354         bool allZero = true;
00355 
00356         for (i=0; i< FFMIN(numSamples, 2000);i++)
00357         {
00358           snprintf(string+(5*i), sizeof(string)-5*i, "%04hX.", inBuf[i]);
00359           if (inBuf[i] != 0)
00360             allZero = false;
00361         }
00362         VS_LOG_DEBUG("Input Buffer (%d): %s", numSamples, string);
00363 
00364         for (i=0; i< FFMIN((unsigned int)retval, 2000);i++)
00365         {
00366           snprintf(string+(9*i), sizeof(string)-9*i, "%04hX%04hX.",
00367               outBuf[2*i], outBuf[2*i+1]);
00368           if (outBuf[2*i] != 0 || outBuf[2*i+1] != 0)
00369             allZero = false;
00370         }
00371         VS_LOG_DEBUG("Output Buffer (%d): %s", retval, string);
00372         if (!allZero)
00373           VS_LOG_DEBUG("Got an audio buffer with content");
00374       }
00375 #endif // 0
00376 
00377       if (retval >= 0)
00378       {
00379         // copy the Pts
00380         int64_t pts = Global::NO_PTS;
00381         if (inSamples)
00382         {
00383           pts = inSamples->getPts();
00384           mNextPts = pts + IAudioSamples::samplesToDefaultPts(retval, mOSampleRate);
00385         }
00386         else
00387         {
00388           pts = mNextPts;
00389         }
00390         if (pts != Global::NO_PTS)
00391           pts += mPtsOffset;
00392 
00393         outSamples->setComplete(true, retval,
00394             mOSampleRate, mOChannels,
00395             mOFmt,
00396             pts);
00397         int expectedSamples = 0;
00398         if (inSamples)
00399         {
00400           double top = mOSampleRate;
00401           double bottom = mISampleRate;
00402           double sampleOnlyConverstionRatio = top / bottom;
00403           expectedSamples = (int)(numSamples * sampleOnlyConverstionRatio);
00404         }
00405         else
00406         {
00407           VS_LOG_TRACE("Got null samples; outputted all cached and set pts offset from %lld to 0",
00408               mPtsOffset);
00409           expectedSamples = retval;
00410           // and reset the offset
00411           mPtsOffset = 0;
00412         }
00413 
00414         if (retval != expectedSamples)
00415         {
00416           // we got a different number of samples than expected; we need to update
00417           // our pts offset
00418           int sampleDelta = retval - expectedSamples;
00419           int64_t ptsDelta = IAudioSamples::samplesToDefaultPts(sampleDelta, mOSampleRate);
00420           mPtsOffset += ptsDelta;
00421         }
00422       }
00423     }
00424     catch (std::invalid_argument & e)
00425     {
00426       VS_LOG_DEBUG("invalid argument: %s", e.what());
00427       retval = -1;
00428     }
00429 
00430     return retval;
00431   }
